result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryan K. Dodd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bryan K. Dodd

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per Judge Bloom, adjust lentgh of probation by 5 weeks - amend JOC to reflect.
Email from DOC concerning length of probation

04:07 PM - Defendant Bryan K. Dodd in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Defendant Bryan K. Dodd in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant currently serving 90 days jail as part of original sentence.  Current charge requires defendant to report as Sex Offend.  Motion filed to vacate plea, amend charge and then re-sentence.  Court finds defendant's plea was not knowingly entered into.  State moves to amend charge to 948.10 - Expose genitals to child a Class I Felony - Granted.  Defendant pleads guilty.  Plea questionnaire filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Court continues disposition already set forth. 
Court Sentence
WHS/POP 2 yrs
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
AODA assessment and recovery
No Contact with minor child as identified in complaint
No Social Media contact with anyone under age of 18
90 days jail with huber for all purposes - Jail credit 3 days - upon revocation - Presentence Credit of 41 days - Currently serving this sentence
Submit DNA Sample
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights given
to Withdraw Plea and Vacate Sentence

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Case called 11:21 am.:  Defendant Bryan K. Dodd in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Bednar statement to court - states defendant to plead guilty/no contest - withhold sentence , 2 years probation, 90 days in jail as condition of probation/undergo AODA/follow through/no contact iwth minor child as identified/no social media contact with anyone under age of 18. Plus court costs
Atty Burns -states defendant pleads guilty.
Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. 

Plea Questionnaire filed
Atty Bednar statement to court regarding sentencing.
Atty Burns statement to court and asks court to follow joint recommendations 
Defendant statement to court. 

Court finds defendant guilty and

Court places defendant on probation
WHS 2 years conditions of probation - AODA-follow through 
No Contact with minor child as identified in complaint
No Social Media contact with anyone under age of 18
90 days jail with huber for all purposes
to begin immediately - defendant remanded to jail
Participate in any treatment given to him by probation agent
Court Costs relative to this count 
3 days jail credit will not be credited towards 90 days

Atty Burns statement regarding defendant's computer - court states defendant and Sheriff's Dept will have to work through
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

09:33 am - Defendant Bryan K. Dodd in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.  State files Information - Burns - In receipt and waives reading - not guilty plea entered.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 11:00 am.

02:58 pm - Defendant Bryan K. Dodd in court with attorney Mary Hogan for Mary L.R. Burns.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived
Bail continued

01:21 pm - Defendant Bryan K. Dodd in court.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failed to appear on 12-15-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Defendant was not sure what time court appearance was scheduled for - thought appearance was scheduled for 4:30 p.m.  Court quashes warrant - not yet issued.  Court questions defendant as to obtaining counsel.  Defendant states was not going to obtain counsel.  Defendant would like to proceed on own.  Waiver/benefits of counsel free and voluntary.  Court questions defendant as to proceeding.  Defendant unsure as to waiving or scheduling a prelim - will contact an attorney.  Bail continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 12, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Bryan K. Dodd not in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:47
NO appearance by defendant - Court authorizes warrant -

may not use computer/laptop, cell phone for email/texts, etc. may use cell phone for phone call only,  or any electronic device, no contact w/B.R.W., no intoxicants, to taverns, no controlled substances, no prescription medications which are not prescribed to defendant, required to submit to bodily fluid test by any law enforcement without probable cause.

01:28 pm - Reese for Bloom.  Defendant Bryan K. Dodd in court, via video, in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will obtain counsel,  Bednar statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 15, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
